contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox company | name = Xicat Interactive, Inc. | logo = | type = Private | foundation = | location = Fort Lauderdale, Florida, (USA) | key_people = | area_served = | industry = [[Computer and video game industry|Computer and video games]] | products = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | num_employees = | parent = | subsid = | homepage = }} '''Xicat Interactive''' was a [[video game]] [[Video game publisher|publisher]] with distribution across Europe and North America. Xicat held several significant licenses including: [[Gothic (computer game)|Gothic]], [[Motor Trend]], [[Jane's Information Group]] and [[Guns & Ammo]].<ref>[http://www.mobygames.com/company/xicat-interactive-inc MobyGames - Xicat Interactive, Inc<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> But on the other hand, this company caused nonpayment of development expenses, and was appealed to the court in many case. Especially nonpayment troubles gave rise to Japan game companies. ==Games published/distributed== {{col-begin|width=75%}} {{col-2}} *''[[The Amazing Virtual Sea Monkeys]]'' *''[[Ballistics (video game)|Ballistics]]'' *''[[Black Belt Challenge]]'' *''[[Black Stone: Magic & Steel]]'' *''[[Carmageddon TDR2000|Carmageddon TDR 2000]]'' *''[[Charge 'N Blast]]'' *''[[Cultures (computer game series)|Cultures]]'' *''[[Coaster Works]]'' *''[[CowHunter]]'' *''[[Demonworld: Dark Armies]]'' *''[[Fila World Tennis]]'' *''[[Flight Unlimited]]'' *''[[F/A-18 Hornet|F/A-18 Precision Strike Fighter]]'' *''[[Gothic (computer game)|Gothic]]'' *''[[Haven: Call of the King]]'' *''[[Hot Wired]]'' *''[[Incoming]]'' *''[[Invader (video game)|Invader]]'' {{col-2}} *''[[Iron Aces]]'' *''[[Iron Aces 2: Birds of Prey]]'' *''[[Jane's Attack Squadron|Jane's Combat Simulations: Attack Squadron]]'' *''[[Larry Ragland 4x4 Challenge]]'' *''[[Lotus Challenge]]'' *''[[Metal Dungeon]]'' *''[[Rally Challenge 2000]]'' *''[[Sniper: Path of Vengeance]]'' *''[[Takeda (computer game)|Takeda]]'' *''[[Top Angler: Real Bass Fishing]]'' *''[[US Special Forces: Team Factor]]'' *''[[Wetrix]]'' *''[[X-Plane (simulator)|X-Plane 6]]'' *''[[Zanzarah: The Hidden Portal]]'' {{col-end}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{wayback|*/http://xicat.com|Xicat Interactive official website}} [[Category:Defunct video game companies]] [[Category:Video game publishers]] {{Europe-videogame-company-stub}}
